channel.title: [New Class] The Taskmaster / Overseer
channel.description:
**Faction:** *Blue Dragon/Unseen*
**Class Type:** *Offensive*
**Passives:** **Dutiful** : Immune to most occupation and redirection abilities. You will keep this passive even if your class changes. **Week of 100 hours**:You cannot target the same player two nights in a row with **GET TO WORK!**. If you do, the targeted player will have a heart attack and die. (Does not bypass death immunity, can be healed)
**Day abilities:**
**Duplicate efforts** (3 uses): Remove the player-cooldown of **GET TO WORK!**.
**Night abilities** :
**GET TO WORK!** (infinite uses): Chose a player, that player will visit his target no matter what happens. The next night they will be exhausted, preventing them from visiting their target.
**Intermission** (2 uses): All visits on you affect the chosen player instead.
Unseen converted has the exact same skills, like Alcoholic. There is no notification to **GET TO WORK!**, the targeted player will visit his target, even if it is jailed. If a player doesnt try to visit anyone, **GET TO WORK!** has no effect, neither does using it twice on them with **Duplicate efforts**.
Point of the class? Imagine a big guy/girl with a bigger whip shouting at the Physician/Sheriff/Assassin "GET TO WORK!"
Edit1: Reworded some stuff, should be a lot clearer now.

item.title: [New Class] The Taskmaster / Overseer
item.dc:creator: NAOtheRitualist
item.description:
Anglasut:

Like merc brilder pasive, its to take some text off GET TO WORK!

I understand but this isn’t Mercenary. This is a new class that doesn’t earn anything from their abilities , thus I suggest adding it to the description.

Anglasut:

You only make sure that your target VISITS, he can visit someone thats being healed/knighted, so its not frenzy, you can kill someone in jail, or ignore a butler occ, but thats it, it just prevents preventions. Also if you use it twice, Assassin dies and you become Assassin.

Misunderstanding here. I meant that if you use Duplicate Efforts 3 times in a row and there are no healers/knights in the game , you could secure 3 kills AND you give KPN to the Unseen which is not good.

Anglasut:

If a butler tries to occupy 10, and you GET TO WORK! 10, the butler will occupy him, but 10 wont know, since you aided him. Butler sees that he occupied him, and 10 sees that he was not prevented.

GET TO WORK! is just the CW empower on Supports but for everyone, and even tho imo its op as fuck, we need this kind of skill

This does more damage to the BD than you think.
Example:
Butler occupies X.
You use Get To Work on X.
Butler whispers the king that X was successfully occupied.
X whispers the king to say what they did last night.
There are 2 outcomes :
1) The Butler is gonna get executed and they will be suspicious of X. If X is BD and they get jailed + exe’d , that’s your fault for killing 2 BD.
2) X is gonna get executed and they will be suspicious of The Butler. The Butler will die because of you.

Anglasut:

This does not notify, if you target 10, and that night you are attacked, healed and investigated, those skills will affect 10 instead, but the people that target you will think that they attacked/healed/investigated you.

And last of all , to add a little twist to your ability : I would suggest making it 1 use , silent and vice-versa.

item.title: [New Class] The Taskmaster / Overseer
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
Anglasut:

GET TO WORK! (infinite uses): Chose a player, that player will visit his target no matter what happens. The next night they will be exhausted, preventing them from visiting their target. You cannot target the same player two nights in a row. If you do, the targeted player will have a heart attack and die.

So basically it is guaranteed visit with potential kill power, albeit delayed. That’s fair and mostly balanced (it should not bypass immunity)

What I do see as necessary is cutting down this wall of text.

Intermission, on the other hand, should be changed to be less confirmable. In its current form, it confirms you off of two potential visits (yourself and target).

I’d find a way to change it to “all visits on you affect the target chosen”
